aws::graph::propositions: Amazon recorded approximately $720 million in estimated severance costs for the year ended December 31, 2022.
$640 million of the severance costs was recorded in the fourth quarter of 2022.
The severance costs in 2022 were primarily related to planned role eliminations.
The severance charges in 2022 were recorded primarily in "Technology and infrastructure" category.
The severance charges in 2022 were recorded primarily in "Fulfillment" category.
The severance charges in 2022 were recorded primarily in "General and administrative" category.
The severance charges in 2022 primarily impacted Amazon's North America segment.
Charges for impairment were not material to Amazon's consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2023.
Charges for impairment were not material to Amazon's consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2024.
Expenses for terminating contracts were not material to Amazon's consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2023.
Expenses for terminating contracts were not material to Amazon's consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2024.

Severance costs were not material to Amazon's consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2023.
Severance costs were not material to Amazon's consolidated results of operations for the year ended December 31, 2024.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 — DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 1 — DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS, ACCOUNTING POLICIES, AND SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES/

text:
For the year ended December 31, 2022, we recorded approximately $ 720 million, of which $ 640 million was recorded in the fourth quarter, of estimated severance costs primarily related to planned role eliminations. These charges were recorded primarily in “Technology and infrastructure,” “Fulfillment,” and “General and administrative” and primarily impacted our North America segment.

Charges for impairment, expenses for terminating contracts and other commitments, and severance costs were not material to our consolidated results of operations for the years ended December 31, 2023 and 2024.
